title: How to Bake White Chocolate Brownies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spray a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with non-stick greasing spray.
Melt the white chocolate and butter over low heat in a saucepan.
steps.description: Cook until fully melted and then set aside to cool.

steps.headline: Beat the eggs, vanilla, and sugar using a whisk in a large mixing bowl.
Fold in the flour and salt and stir until well-combined.
steps.description: Mix until there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Spread the brownie batter into the baking pan.
steps.description: Scrape any excess batter using a rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Sprinkle white chocolate chips all over the batter.
Bake the brownies in the oven for about 30-35 minutes, until a toothpick poked in the middle comes out dry.
Have the brownies cool for about 10 minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Slice the brownies using a cutting knife. Place on a serving plate. Enjoy!

text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).  Spray a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with non-stick greasing spray.  Melt the white chocolate and butter over low heat in a saucepan. Cook until fully melted and then set aside to cool. Beat the eggs, vanilla, and sugar using a whisk in a large mixing bowl.  Pour in the butter mixture. Mix well with a whisk. Fold in the flour and salt and stir until well-combined. Mix until there are no more flour streaks. Spread the brownie batter into the baking pan. Scrape any excess batter using a rubber spatula. Sprinkle white chocolate chips all over the batter.  Bake the brownies in the oven for about 30-35 minutes, until a toothpick poked in the middle comes out dry.  Have the brownies cool for about 10 minutes.  Serve. Slice the brownies using a cutting knife. Place on a serving plate. Enjoy! Finished.
